div.l: Thise iiij sparkles longen vnto elde
Oure olde lymmes mowe wele bee vnwelde
But whilom̄e ne shall nat faill that is sothe
Yette haueth alwey a coltes tothe
As many a yere as it is passed henne
Seth that my tappe of life beganne to renne
For sikerly whenne I was borne anone
Deth drowe the tappe of life and let it gone
And euer seth soo hath the tappe y ronne
Tille that almoste all empty ys the tonne
The streme of life nowe droppeth in the chymbe
The sely tym may welle rynge and chymbe
Of wrecchednesse that passed is full yore
With olde folke saue dotage there is no more
Whenne that oure hooste hadde herde this ʆsermonyng
He ganne to speke as lordely as a kinge
He seide what amounteth all this witte
What shalle we speke all day of holy writte
The deuyll made a reve for to preche
Or a sowter a shipman or a leche
Sey forth thy tale and tary nat the tyme
Loo depforth and it is well nygh pryme
Loo grenewich that many a shrewe is ynne
It were all tyme thy tale to begynne
Nowe sirs quoth Oswolde the Reve
I pray you all that ye you nat greve
Though I answere and somedell set his hove
For liefull is with force  force of to shove
This drunken miller hath tolde vs here
Howe that begiled was a carpentere
Par auenture in scorne for I am one
And by youre leve I shall him quite anone
Right in his cherles termes woll I speke
I pray to god his nek muste to breke
He canne well in myne yie seen a stalke
But in his owen he can nat seen a balke
Atte trumpingtoıı̄un nat fer from cambrigge
Ther goth a broke and oủere that a brigge
Vpon the which brooke there stant a mylle
This is verrey soth that I you telle
A miller was there dwellinge many a day
As eny pecok he was proude and gay
Pipen he couthe and fissh and nettes bete
And turne cuppes and wrastell and eke shete
Euer by his belte he bare a longe panade
And of a swerde full trenchaunte was the blade
A ioly popper bare he in his pouche
There was no man for ꝑperill durste him touche
A sheffelde thwitelle bare he in his hose
Rounde was his face and cammoys was his nose
As pilled as an ape was his sculle
He was a market beter atte the fulle
There durste no wight honde vpon him legge
That he ne swore he shulde anone abegge
A thefe he was forsoth of corne and mele
And that a slye and vsante for to stele
His name was hoten deynous symkyn
A wyf he hadde commen of noble kyn
The person of the toune hir fader was
Wᵗith hir he yaue full many a panne of bras
For that symkyn shulde in hirshishir blode allye
She was fustred in a nonnerye
For symkynne wolde no wife as he seide
But she were welle norisshed and a meyde
To sauen his estate and yomanrye
And she was proude and pert as is a pye
A fulle feire sight was it on hem twoo
On holidaies before hem wolde he goo
With his tipette wounde aboute his hede
And she come after in a gyte of rede
And symkyn had hosin of the same
There durste no wight clepen hir but dame
Was none soo hardy that wente by the wey
That with hir durste rage or ones pley
But if he wolde be slayne of kymkyn
With swerde or with knyfe or boydekyn data added for collation
